description: Tracks and manages the full lifecycle of a business analysis engagement â€” from stakeholder mapping and requirements elicitation through process modeling, analysis artifacts, KPIs, decisions, change requests, and deliverables.
name: BusinessAnalysis

operations.name: SET_PROJECT_INFO
operations.schema:
input SetProjectInfoInput {
  projectName: String
  projectDescription: String
  organization: String
  sponsor: String
  startDate: DateTime
  targetEndDate: DateTime
}

operations.description: Transitions the project to a new phase
operations.name: SET_PROJECT_PHASE
operations.reducer: state.projectPhase = action.input.phase;
operations.template: Transitions the project to a new phase

operations.name: SET_PROJECT_STATUS
operations.reducer: state.projectStatus = action.input.status;

modules.description: Stakeholder registry, engagement tracking, and influence mapping
modules.name: stakeholders

operations.description: Adds a new stakeholder to the registry
operations.name: ADD_STAKEHOLDER
operations.reducer:
state.stakeholders.push({
  id: action.input.id,
  name: action.input.name,
  role: action.input.role || null,
  organization: action.input.organization || null,
  email: action.input.email || null,
  influence: action.input.influence || null,
  interest: action.input.interest || null,
  engagementLevel: action.input.engagementLevel || null,
  notes: action.input.notes || null,
  createdAt: action.input.createdAt,
});
operations.schema:
input AddStakeholderInput {
  id: OID!
  name: String!
  role: String
  organization: String
  email: String
  influence: StakeholderInfluence
  interest: StakeholderInterest
  engagementLevel: EngagementLevel
  notes: String
  createdAt: DateTime!
}
operations.template: Adds a new stakeholder to the registry

errors.description: Stakeholder with the given ID was not found
errors.name: UpdateStakeholderNotFoundError

operations.name: UPDATE_STAKEHOLDER
operations.schema:
input UpdateStakeholderInput {
  id: OID!
  name: String
  role: String
  organization: String
  email: String
  influence: StakeholderInfluence
  interest: StakeholderInterest
  notes: String
}

modules.description: Requirements lifecycle with traceability, categories, and acceptance criteria
modules.name: requirements

operations.name: ADD_REQUIREMENT
operations.reducer:
state.requirements.push({
  id: action.input.id,
  code: action.input.code || null,
  title: action.input.title,
  description: action.input.description || null,
  type: action.input.type,
  priority: action.input.priority || null,
  status: "DRAFT",
  categoryId: action.input.categoryId || null,
  parentRequirementId: action.input.parentRequirementId || null,
  effort: action.input.effort || null,
  source: action.input.source || null,
  rationale: action.input.rationale || null,
  acceptanceCriteria: [],
  linkedRequirementIds: [],
  linkedProcessIds: [],
  stakeholderIds: action.input.stakeholderIds || [],
  tags: action.input.tags || [],
  createdAt: action.input.createdAt,
  updatedAt: null,
});
operations.schema:
input AddRequirementInput {
  id: OID!
  code: String
  title: String!
  description: String
  type: RequirementType!
  priority: Priority
  categoryId: OID
  parentRequirementId: OID
  effort: String
  source: String
  rationale: String
  stakeholderIds: [OID!]
  tags: [String!]
  createdAt: DateTime!
}

  tags: [String!]

}
